intro: Hesperis vrabelyiana, commonly known as the Vrabel's honesty, is a rare flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are white with a faint pinkish hue, and it blooms from June to August. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
